question: Among the given pair of vectors, the resultant of two vectors can never be 3 units. The vectors are
explanation: The resultant <katex>$R$</katex> of two vectors <katex>$A$</katex> and <katex>$B$</katex> lies in <katex>$|A-B| \le R \le |A+B|$</katex>.
For 4 and 8: Range is <katex>$[4, 12]$</katex>. 3 is outside this range.
